verses.verse: Where <S%H575><s%> is your beloved <S%H1730><s%> gone, <S%H1980><s%> O you fairest <S%H3303><s%> among women? <S%H802><s%> where <S%H575><s%> is your beloved <S%H1730><s%> turned <S%H6437><s%> aside? <S%H6437><s%> that we may seek <S%H1245><s%> him with you.

My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is gone <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> into his garden, <S%H1588><s%> to the beds <S%H6170><s%> of spices, <S%H1314><s%> to feed <S%H7462><s%> in the gardens, <S%H1588><s%> and to gather <S%H3950><s%> lilies. <S%H7799><s%>
I am my beloved's, <S%H1730><s%> and my beloved <S%H1730><s%> is mine: he feeds <S%H7462><s%> among the lilies. <S%H7799><s%>
You are beautiful, <S%H3303><s%> O my love, <S%H7474><s%> as Tirzah, <S%H8656><s%> comely <S%H5000><s%> as Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> terrible <S%H366><s%> as an army with banners. <S%H1713><s%>

Turn <S%H5437><s%> away your eyes <S%H5869><s%> from me, for they have overcome <S%H7292><s%> me: your hair <S%H8181><s%> is as a flock <S%H5739><s%> of goats <S%H5795><s%> that appear <S%H1570><s%> from Gilead. <S%H1568><s%>

Your teeth <S%H8127><s%> are as a flock <S%H5739><s%> of sheep <S%H7353><s%> which go <S%H5927><s%> up from the washing, <S%H7367><s%> whereof every <S%H3605><s%> one <S%H259><s%> bears <S%H8382><s%> twins, <S%H8382><s%> and there is not one <S%H259><s%> barren <S%H7909><s%> among them.
As a piece <S%H6400><s%> of a pomegranate <S%H7416><s%> are your temples <S%H7541><s%> within <S%H1157><s%> your locks. <S%H6777><s%>
There are three score <S%H7657><s%> queens, <S%H4436><s%> and fourscore <S%H8084><s%> concubines, <S%H6370><s%> and virgins <S%H5959><s%> without <S%H369><s%> number. <S%H4557><s%>

My dove, <S%H3123><s%> my undefiled <S%H8535><s%> is but one; <S%H259><s%> she is the only one <S%H259><s%> of her mother, <S%H517><s%> she is the choice <S%H1249><s%> one <S%H259><s%> of her that bore <S%H3205><s%> her. The daughters <S%H1323><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> her, and blessed <S%H833><s%> her; yes, the queens <S%H4436><s%> and the concubines, <S%H6370><s%> and they praised <S%H1984><s%> her.

Who <S%H4310><s%> is she that looks <S%H8259><s%> forth as the morning, <S%H7837><s%> fair <S%H3303><s%> as the moon, <S%H3842><s%> clear <S%H1249><s%> as the sun, <S%H2535><s%> and terrible <S%H366><s%> as an army with banners? <S%H1713><s%>

I went <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> into <S%H413><s%> the garden <S%H1594><s%> of nuts <S%H93><s%> to see <S%H7200><s%> the fruits <S%H3><s%> of the valley, <S%H5158><s%> and to see <S%H7200><s%> whether the vine <S%H1612><s%> flourished <S%H6524><s%>and the pomegranates <S%H7416><s%> budded. <S%H5132><s%>
Or ever <S%H3808><s%> I was aware, <S%H3045><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> made <S%H7760><s%> me like the chariots <S%H4818><s%> of Amminadib. <S%H5993><s%>

Return, <S%H7725><s%> return, <S%H7725><s%> O Shulamite; <S%H7759><s%> return, <S%H7725><s%> return, <S%H7725><s%> that we may look <S%H2372><s%> on you. What <S%H4100><s%> will you see <S%H2372><s%> in the Shulamite? <S%H7759><s%> As it were the company <S%H4246><s%> of two armies. <S%H4264><s%>
